form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide support services for family caregivers of disabled veterans, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Wounded Warrior Caregiver Assistance Act.

subsection.text: Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

The Secretary shall make available interactive training sessions for family caregivers and individuals who provide such caregivers support under this chapter or through the aging network (including respite care providers, nursing care providers, and counselors). Such training shall—

paragraph.text: be made available both in person and on an Internet website;
incorporate telehealth technologies to the extent practicable; and
teach techniques, strategies, and skills for caring for a disabled veteran, including, at a minimum, effective methods of—

clause.text: with post-traumatic stress disorder or a traumatic brain injury; and
who was deployed in support of Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom; and

subparagraph.text: recording details regarding the health of the veteran.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall provide family caregivers with information concerning public, private, and non-profit agencies that offer support to such caregivers. In providing such information, the Secretary shall—

paragraph.text: collaborate with the Assistant Secretary for Aging of the Department of Health and Human Services in order to provide family caregivers access to Aging and Disability Resource Centers under the Administration on Aging of the Department of Health and Human Services; and
contract with a private entity to provide family caregivers with an Internet-based service that contains—

subparagraph.text: a directory of services available at the county level;

message boards and other similar tools that provide family caregivers with the ability to interact with each other and disabled veterans for the purpose of fostering peer support and creating support networks; and
comprehensive information explaining health-related topics and issues relevant to the needs of disabled veterans and family caregivers.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall conduct outreach to inform disabled veterans and the families of such veterans of the services under this section. Such outreach shall include the following:

paragraph.text: Full use of Internet-based outreach methods, including—

subparagraph.text: methods designed specifically for rural families; and
establishing a web page on the Internet website of the Department that—

clause.text: is dedicated to caregiver support; and
contains interactive elements, including providing information based on the location of the person using the web page.

paragraph.text: The term aging network has the meaning given that term in section 102(5) of the Older Americans Act of 1965 (42 U.S.C. 3002(5)).
The term caregiver services means noninstitutional extended care (as used in section 1701(6) of this title), including homemaker and home health aid services.
The term family caregiver means an individual who—

subparagraph.text: provides caregiver services to such veteran for such disability; and
may or may not reside with such veteran.

subsection.text: Section 1782 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

section.header: Respite care to assist family caregivers
section.text: Section 1720B of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking title. and inserting title or who receives care from a family caregiver as defined in section 1786 of this title.; and
by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: In furnishing respite care services under this section, the Secretary shall ensure that such services—

paragraph.text: fulfill the needs of the veteran receiving care; and
are appropriate for the veteran (including by taking the age of the veteran into account when selecting the respite care provided to such veteran).
